entry.title: Daily Entry
entry.temperatureHelp: Take your temperature every morning upon waking, BEFORE getting up. Always use the same method (oral, rectal, vaginal).
entry.excludedHelp: Check if the reading is unusual (fever, alcohol, restless night). It won't be used in calculations.
entry.mucusHelp: Observe the sensation and appearance at the vaginal opening. Record the best quality of the day.

mucusDescriptions.ø: Nothing noticeable, neither dry nor wet
mucusDescriptions.S: Visible mucus, stretchy, like raw egg white
mucusDescriptions.S+: Very stretchy, transparent, highly elastic mucus

entry.bleedingHelp: Day 1 of cycle = first day of normal bleeding. Spotting doesn't count as day 1.

bleedingDescriptions.spotting: Light traces, pink or brown spots

entry.symptomsHelp: This information is for your reference, it doesn't affect fertility calculation.

cycle.newConfirm: Confirm start of a new cycle?
cycle.newHint: Day 1 should be the first day of normal bleeding (not spotting)

fiveDay.detail: The first 5 days after your period starts are generally infertile. This rule only applies if your last 12 cycles were at least 26 days long AND no cervical mucus appears during these days.

minus8.detail: If you've been tracking for several months, the app uses your history: it takes the earliest day your temperature rose, then subtracts 8 days to determine when fertility begins.

minus20.detail: For new users: we take your shortest cycle length and subtract 20 days. This is a wide safety margin for the first cycles of observation.

tempShift.detail: Ovulation is confirmed when 3 consecutive temperatures are above the 'cover line' (calculated from the previous 6 temperatures). The 3rd must be at least 0.2°C above.

mucusPeak.detail: The 'peak' is the last day you observe high quality mucus (clear, stretchy). After 3 days of lower quality mucus, the peak is confirmed retrospectively.

doubleCheck.detail: Post-ovulatory infertility is only confirmed when BOTH signs (temperature AND mucus) agree. We always take whichever comes last for safety.

exception1.detail: If the 3rd high temperature isn't high enough (less than 0.2°C above the line), a 4th high temperature is needed for confirmation.

exception2.detail: If one of the 3 high temperatures was disturbed (alcohol, poor sleep, illness), 4 high temperatures total are needed to confirm ovulation.
